titleStmt.title: The historie of that vvise and fortunate prince, Henrie of that name the seventh, King of England With that famed battaile, fought betweene the sayd King Henry and Richard the third named Crookbacke, upon Redmoore neere Bosworth. In a poem by Charles Aleyn.
titleStmt.author: Aleyn, Charles, d. 1640.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Tho. Cotes, for William Cooke, and are to be sold at his shop, neere Furnivalls-Inne gate in Holburne,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: The history of Henry the Seventh.
Line 3 of the title page (A1) ends (1) "of" or (2) "wise". The last verses on leaf A2 are signed (1) "Thy true lover, Ed. Prideaux." or (2) "Ed. Prideaux.".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop, neere Furnivalls-Inne gate in Holburne
